name: Victor / Hector  2HR / 2HR +
language: 2HR : None, Basic available on tape2HR+ : Basic Level III integrated in ROM
ram: 48 KB, 20 KB left for the user when Basic III loaded
graphics: 112 x 78 with 8 colors243 x 231 with 4 colors
ports: 2 joystick socketsVideo output (Scart,  Secam)Centronics, Rom pack, Disc-drive on the same port
description: The 2HR (HR for High Resolution) is the successor of the Victor / Hector 16k models, but this time is conception is entirely french. The machine has been completely redesigned and this new model is then more powerful. This is in fact a completely new machine with more memory and high-resolution. It is still compatible with the 16k models in a "model 1" mode choosen at the start-up menu.

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>> VICTOR 2HR</strong></font><br><blockquote>Its name is still Victor, but the logo has changed... The tape-recorder keys are also different from the first Victor 2HR. Note the expansion port on the left side of the computer.</blockquote>
<br><font color="red"><strong>> HECTOR 2HR</strong></font><br><blockquote>Well, now it's the name that changes ! Victor becomes Hector...</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> HECTOR 2HR+</strong></font><br><blockquote>Something is different, guess what ? The keyboard is AZERTY ! But the main difference of the 2HR+ is that the Basic is now built-in ROM. No more tape to load each time you want to program something...</blockquote>

<br><font color="red"><strong>> HECTOR 2HR+</strong></font><br><blockquote>Around 1985, the Hector 2HR+ was produced with a kind of metal colored case, something like "bronze-grey-purple".</blockquote>

item.description: DISC 2|||Double disk drive|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> DISC 2</strong></font><br><strong>> Double disk drive</strong><br><blockquote>Here is the DISC2, the double disk-drive for the Victor / Hector computers, produced around 83. Isn't it big ?! But it was aboveall quite expensive ! 6500 fr for one 200k disk-drive... <br><br> In fact, the DISC2 specifications are not very clear and it seems that there were several versions produced... In 83, the disk-drive capacity seems to be 200k whereas in 85 there are two versions : 360k et 720k. <br><br> Anyway, they are both 5"1/4 disk-drives and the operating system runs under CP/M 2.2. </blockquote>

DISC2|||Another picture|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> DISC2</strong></font><br><strong>> Another picture</strong><br><blockquote>Here is what a Hector advert says about the Disc 2:<br> - Intelligent disk drive (!)<br> - 64k RAM, 4k ROM<br> - CP/M 2.2 Operating System<br> - The "DISC2 communication system" (COS) only takes 1k in the Hector memory.<br> - Sold with 1 or 2 disk-drives<br> - A second Disc2 can be connected to the first one<br> - Capacity from 167.936 characters to 671.744 characters. <br><br> Apparently the Disc2, was conceived to be used with the HRX (and the MX of course), but the advert offers free adaptation of the 2HR+ for a Disc2 purchased.  </blockquote>
DISC2|||First model|||<br><font color="red"><strong>> DISC2</strong></font><br><strong>> First model</strong><br><blockquote>Here the "DISC2" logo differs from the later versions.</blockquote>
DISC2 prototype||||||<br><font color="red"><strong>> DISC2 PROTOTYPE</strong></font><br><blockquote>Michel Henric Coll, the man behind the Hectors, presents the Disc2 prototype in 1983.</blockquote>

emulator.name: MESS - Interact, Hector1, Victor, 2HR, 2HR+, HRX, MX40, MX80
emulator.description: All machines are emulated since 0.136 and Disc2 until 0.141 by Yo_Fr
